text:
I’m having an issue where only the following article (the second from the last) does not link properly from the “次の記事へ/Next Article” button in a blog. I checked and searched around for answers but can’t find any. Has anyone else experienced this issue and if so, how did you fix it? `{% if content.previous_post_slug %}` `
  • 前の記事へ
    • ` `{% endif %}` `
  • 一覧を見る
    • ` `{% if content.next_post_slug %}` `
  • 次の記事へ
    • ` `{% endif %}`

If there is no next post, that link won’t won’t appear. how have you determined that there is a next post that isn’t showing? Are you looking inside the blog? How do you have the blogs organized? Is it possible your “next post” is published? Is really the next post? When you visit the all posts page, is your “next post” the last post in all posts?

<@U25PYL3Q8>
It’s not as easy as it sounds. There’s both a previous and next button, but even though there’s a blog entry that isn’t the last entry, it links nowhere other than the top of the page.
